introduction.label: Getting Started
introduction.comment:
Thank you for using «Customer Credit Limit». To configure this extension, follow the list below or watch our setup guide video:

  • In the first field, set a credit limit per customer. This is the maximum amount of open invoices a customer can have before the selected payment methods will be blocked.
  • In the second field, select which payment methods should be blocked once the credit limit in the first field has been reached. The customer then won't be able to select this payment method again until his credit been lowered below the maximum specified in the first field, by paying some of his open invoices.

If you have any questions or feel that something doesn't work as it should, feel free to contact us at info@mobweb.ch.

order_status.label: Order Status Filter
order_status.comment: Select one or multiple order states to filter the orders by. Only orders with one of the selected states will be cancelled.

payment_methods.label: Payment Method Filter
payment_methods.comment: Select one or multiple payment methods to filter the orders by. Only orders made using one of the selected payment methods will be cancelled.

expiration_time_days.label: Expiration Time (Days)
expiration_time_days.comment: After how many days should the orders be cancelled?

expiration_time_hours.label: Expiration Time (Hours)
expiration_time_hours.comment: After how many hours should the orders be cancelled? Please note that the hours will be added to the days in the previous field. So if you entered "2" in the previous field and "12" in this field, any unpaid order will be cancelled after 2 days and 12 hours.
